definitions: formal contract or covenant between parties or states
small flat case containing face powder or makeup
automobile smaller than standard size designed for efficiency
examples: The Mayflower Compact established governing principles for the new colony
Native tribes signed compacts with the federal government regarding land rights
She pulled a powder compact from her purse to check her makeup
The antique silver compact belonged to her grandmother
They chose a compact for better fuel economy and easier parking
The rental agency only had compacts available that weekend

definitions: act or process of pressing materials together to reduce volume or increase density
geological or engineering process where soil particles are pressed together reducing pore space
examples: The compaction of waste reduces landfill space requirements significantly
Snow compaction on mountain roads creates dangerous driving conditions
Soil compaction from heavy machinery affects crop growth patterns
Engineers monitor compaction levels during road construction projects

definitions: person who spends time with another providing company or assistance
object that complements or matches another in a set
book or guide designed to accompany and supplement another work
examples: Her elderly mother needed a companion for the long journey
The dog became his constant companion after retirement
This vase needs its companion piece to complete the set
The companion volume contains all the reference materials
Students found the companion guide helpful for understanding the textbook
The companion app provides interactive exercises for language learners

definitions: experience of having company or being with others providing mutual support
quality of friendship and fellowship between people sharing activities or interests
examples: After his wife died, he missed her companionship terribly
The elderly often suffer from lack of companionship
Their companionship developed through years of working together
She valued the companionship of her book club members

definitions: commercial enterprise or firm engaged in business activities
group of people gathered together for social or professional purposes
state of being with someone providing fellowship or comfort
military unit typically consisting of eighty to two hundred soldiers
examples: The company announced record profits this quarter
She started a software company in her garage
We're expecting company for dinner tonight
The theater company performed Shakespeare all summer
He enjoyed her company during the long train ride
Children need adult company to feel secure
His company was deployed to Afghanistan last month
The captain commands a company of infantry soldiers

definitions: degree to which things can be compared based on shared characteristics or standards
statistical property allowing meaningful comparison between different data sets or measurements
examples: The comparability of prices across different stores helps consumers
International accounting standards ensure comparability of financial statements
Researchers questioned the comparability of results from different laboratories
Data comparability requires consistent measurement methods across studies

definitions: grammatical form expressing higher degree when comparing two things
systematic study comparing different subjects, cultures, or phenomena to identify patterns
examples: 'Better' is the comparative form of the adjective 'good'
Students learned to form comparatives by adding '-er' to adjectives
She teaches comparative literature at the university
His comparative analysis of economic systems won an award

definitions: process of examining things to identify similarities and differences between them
examples: Comparing prices before buying saves money in the long run
The study involved comparing brain scans from different age groups
Scientists spent months comparing DNA samples from various species
Comparing these two approaches reveals their fundamental differences

definitions: examination of two or more things to establish similarities and differences
analogy or illustration showing how things relate to each other
examples: The comparison between the two proposals revealed significant cost differences
Her comparison of ancient and modern architecture was fascinating
By comparison, last year's results were much better
He drew a comparison between the brain and a computer

definitions: separate section or subdivision within a larger space or container
private section of a railway carriage with its own seating area
examples: The jewelry box had compartments for rings and necklaces
Each compartment of the pill organizer holds daily medications
They booked a first-class compartment for the overnight journey
The train compartment seated six passengers comfortably

definitions: deep awareness of others' suffering coupled with the desire to alleviate it
examples: The nurse showed great compassion toward her patients
Teaching children compassion helps create a kinder society
His compassion for homeless animals led him to volunteer
Buddhist philosophy emphasizes compassion for all living beings

definitions: ability of people or things to exist or work together without conflict
capability of different systems or components to work together successfully
examples: Their compatibility made them perfect business partners
The counselor assessed the couple's compatibility before marriage
Software compatibility issues prevented the program from running
Check device compatibility before purchasing new hardware

definitions: person from the same country or nation as another, sharing nationality
examples: She met several compatriots at the embassy reception
Olympic athletes compete against their compatriots for team selection
The expatriates formed a club to help new compatriots adjust
He felt proud watching his compatriots win the tournament

definitions: comprehensive collection of information on a subject gathered into one volume or work
examples: The medical compendium contained treatments for hundreds of conditions
She published a compendium of folk tales from around the world
This compendium of laws helps lawyers find relevant statutes quickly
The gardening compendium became their most consulted reference book

definitions: money and benefits received in exchange for employment or services
payment given to make amends for loss, injury, or suffering
adjustment or counterbalance that offsets a deficiency or imbalance
examples: Her compensation package includes salary, bonuses, and stock options
The board reviewed executive compensation levels annually
Victims received compensation for their injuries in the accident
The airline offered compensation for the delayed flight
The brain shows remarkable compensation after injury to certain areas
Temperature compensation ensures accurate measurements despite environmental changes

definitions: possession of required skills, knowledge, or capacity to perform effectively
legal authority or jurisdiction to hear and decide matters
examples: Her competence in multiple languages impressed the hiring committee
The training program develops core competencies for managers
The court questioned its competence to rule on international matters
This issue falls outside the competence of local authorities

definitions: particular area of skill or knowledge required for effective performance
legal capacity to understand proceedings and make rational decisions
examples: Digital literacy is now considered an essential competency
The job requires competencies in project management and communication
Psychologists assessed his competency to stand trial
Questions arose about her competency to manage her own affairs

definitions: organized event where individuals or teams compete for victory or prizes
rivalry between businesses seeking the same customers or market share
biological interaction where organisms vie for limited resources
examples: She entered the piano competition hoping to win first place
The swimming competition attracted athletes from twenty countries
Competition between retailers keeps prices low for consumers
The company faces stiff competition from overseas manufacturers
Competition for nesting sites intensifies during breeding season
Plants engage in competition for sunlight and soil nutrients

definitions: person or team taking part in a sporting event or contest
company or person competing for the same objective or market
examples: Five hundred competitors entered the marathon this year
The youngest competitor impressed judges with her skill
Our main competitors launched a new product line yesterday
Small businesses struggle to match competitors' advertising budgets

definitions: collection of various items, especially creative works, assembled into one volume
process of gathering and assembling information or materials from various sources
examples: The compilation album features hits from the past decade
She published a compilation of her best short stories
Data compilation took researchers several months to complete
The compilation of voting results revealed surprising patterns

definitions: person who collects and assembles information or materials into organized form
computer program that translates source code into machine-readable instructions
examples: The dictionary compiler spent years gathering word definitions
She worked as a compiler of historical documents
The C++ compiler detected several syntax errors
Modern compilers optimize code for better performance

definitions: process of collecting and organizing information or materials from various sources
examples: Compiling the annual report requires input from all departments
She spent months compiling research for her dissertation
The team is compiling evidence for the upcoming trial
Compiling customer feedback helps improve our services

definitions: state of being satisfied with oneself or situation, often without awareness of potential dangers
examples: Complacency about safety procedures led to the accident
Success can breed complacency if teams stop pushing themselves
Political complacency allows corruption to flourish unchecked
The company's complacency about competition proved costly

definitions: person who makes a formal complaint, especially in legal proceedings
examples: The complainant testified about the harassment she experienced
Police interviewed the complainant about the alleged theft
Multiple complainants came forward with similar allegations
The court protected the complainant's identity during proceedings

definitions: statement expressing dissatisfaction with a situation or service
formal legal document alleging wrongdoing or seeking remedy
physical ailment or medical problem reported by a patient
examples: Customer complaints about service increased last month
She filed a complaint with the manager about noise levels
The lawyer drafted a complaint alleging breach of contract
The complaint was filed in federal court yesterday
His main complaint was persistent back pain
Patients with respiratory complaints should see a specialist

definitions: thing that completes or enhances another by adding what is lacking
full number or quantity of people or things
word or phrase that completes the meaning of a predicate
examples: The wine was a perfect complement to the meal
Her skills complement his expertise beautifully
The ship sailed with a full complement of crew members
The orchestra lacks its usual complement of strings
In 'She seems happy,' 'happy' is a subject complement
Object complements provide additional information about direct objects

definitions: relationship in which different elements enhance each other by supplying what the other lacks
examples: The complementarity of their skills made them effective partners
Economic complementarity between nations encourages trade
Quantum complementarity describes wave-particle duality in physics
The complementarity of opposite personalities can strengthen relationships

definitions: action of finishing or accomplishing a task or process
state of being finished or having all necessary parts
examples: Project completion is expected by the end of June
The completion of her degree took five years
The building awaits completion of final safety inspections
Upon completion, the bridge will span two miles

definitions: group of similar buildings or facilities on the same site
related group of repressed ideas causing emotional or behavioral patterns
molecular structure formed by loose association of molecules or ions
examples: The new shopping complex includes restaurants and a cinema
They live in an apartment complex near the university
His inferiority complex affected his social relationships
The therapist helped her work through her guilt complex
The protein complex plays a crucial role in cell division
Scientists studied the metal-ligand complex formation

definitions: natural color, texture, and appearance of facial skin
general nature or character of something
examples: Her clear complexion required minimal makeup
Sun damage affected his complexion over the years
The new evidence changed the complexion of the case
Recent events altered the political complexion of the region

definitions: state of having many interconnected parts or aspects making something difficult to understand
examples: The complexity of the tax code frustrates many taxpayers
Scientists study the complexity of ecosystem interactions
Adding features increased the software's complexity significantly
The complexity of human emotions defies simple explanation

definitions: act of conforming to rules, regulations, standards, or laws
tendency to yield readily to others' wishes or demands
examples: Regulatory compliance costs the company millions annually
The audit checked compliance with safety standards
Patient compliance with medication schedules improves outcomes
His compliance with every request worried his friends

definitions: circumstance that makes a situation more difficult or complex
secondary medical problem arising during treatment of primary condition
examples: Unexpected complications delayed the project by three months
Legal complications prevented the sale from proceeding
Post-surgical complications required additional medical intervention
Diabetes can lead to serious complications if untreated

definitions: state of being involved with others in illegal or morally wrong activity
examples: Evidence suggested his complicity in the fraud scheme
The investigation revealed widespread complicity among officials
Her silence implied complicity with the discriminatory practices
They denied any complicity in the conspiracy

definitions: polite expression of praise, admiration, or congratulation
formal greeting or expression of regard, often plural
examples: She received many compliments on her presentation skills
His compliment about her dress made her smile
Please give my compliments to the chef
The ambassador conveyed the president's compliments

definitions: part or element that combines with others to form a complete whole
examples: Each component of the machine serves a specific function
The electronic components arrived from overseas suppliers
Trust is an essential component of healthy relationships
Price is just one component of the purchasing decision

definitions: person who writes music, especially classical music as a professional occupation
examples: The composer conducted the premiere of her new symphony
Mozart remains one of history's most celebrated composers
Film composers create soundtracks that enhance emotional impact
The young composer won several prestigious awards

definitions: process of creating music by writing musical notation
act of forming something by putting parts or elements together
examples: She spends hours composing at the piano every morning
Composing film scores requires understanding dramatic pacing
The artist is composing a mosaic from recycled materials
Composing effective paragraphs requires clear topic sentences

definitions: material made from two or more constituent materials with different properties
image or description formed by combining different elements or sources
examples: Carbon fiber composite provides strength with minimal weight
The dental filling uses a tooth-colored composite material
Police created a composite sketch from witness descriptions
The composite image combined photos from multiple telescopes

definitions: piece of music created by a composer
way elements are arranged in an artistic work
written work, especially an essay written by a student
constituent elements and their proportions in a substance
examples: The orchestra performed a new composition by a local composer
Her compositions blend classical and jazz influences
The painting's composition draws the eye toward the center
Photography students studied composition and lighting techniques
Students submitted their compositions on environmental topics
The teacher graded compositions for grammar and content
Scientists analyzed the chemical composition of the meteorite
The composition of the workforce has changed dramatically

definitions: decayed organic material used as plant fertilizer and soil amendment
examples: Adding compost improves soil structure and nutrient content
The garden thrived after they spread compost on the beds
Kitchen scraps go into the compost bin for recycling
Making compost reduces household waste sent to landfills

definitions: state of being calm and in control of emotions, especially in difficult situations
examples: She maintained her composure despite the hostile questioning
The goalkeeper lost his composure after conceding the goal
His composure under pressure impressed the interview panel
Meditation helps people regain composure during stressful times

definitions: area enclosed by a fence or wall containing buildings
substance formed from two or more elements chemically united
thing composed of two or more separate elements combined
examples: Security guards patrol the embassy compound day and night
The military compound housed hundreds of soldiers
Water is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen
Scientists synthesized a new pharmaceutical compound
The problem was a compound of poor planning and bad luck
Interest rates affect compound savings growth

definitions: process of combining elements to form a more complex whole
process by which something increases at an accelerating rate
examples: Compounding medications requires precise measurements and techniques
Word compounding creates new terms from existing ones
Compounding interest helps savings grow exponentially over time
Compounding errors led to the project's complete failure

definitions: ability to understand the meaning or importance of something
action of including or comprising something within a scope
examples: Reading comprehension improves with regular practice
The concept was beyond the students' comprehension
The report's comprehension of all relevant data impressed reviewers
Full comprehension of the issue requires historical context

definitions: British secondary school accepting students of all abilities without selection
examples: She attended the local comprehensive rather than grammar school
The comprehensive replaced the old selective school system
Most comprehensives offer a wide range of academic subjects
The comprehensive has excellent sports facilities

definitions: action of pressing or squeezing something to reduce its volume
process of reducing digital file size through encoding techniques
examples: Compressing the spring stores potential energy
The machine works by compressing air to high pressure
Compressing video files saves storage space
The software is compressing images for faster upload

definitions: reduction in volume caused by applied pressure or force
process of encoding information using fewer bits than original representation
examples: Compression of the gas increases its temperature significantly
Spinal compression can cause severe back pain
Video compression allows streaming over limited bandwidth
Lossless compression preserves all original data

definitions: mechanical device that increases the pressure of gas or air
audio device that reduces the dynamic range of sound signals
examples: The air compressor powers all the pneumatic tools
The refrigerator's compressor needs replacement
The audio compressor evens out volume levels in recordings
Musicians use compressors to control signal dynamics

definitions: settlement of differences through mutual concessions between parties
exposure of something to risk, suspicion, or disrepute
examples: They reached a compromise after hours of negotiation
Marriage often requires compromise from both partners
The data breach could compromise national security
His actions compromise the integrity of the investigation
